page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: The{porous}Greensand plateau is deep -ly disected by the{Sid and Roncombe Stream. The soft, easily eroded, Marls form the steep valley sides which were once densely wooded. On the western side of{East Hill}a straight{Scarp runs unbroken for five miles from Beacon Hill to Westgate Hill. Below this scarp lies a{spring line}which has attracted settlement such as Ware Farm (125958). The waterless plateau top of East Hill has been avoided by settlement however. The other side of East Hill is very different. Deep valleys or{coombes}run into the main Sid valley. The streams that rise here are more powerful and their valleys provide shelter and an assured water supply. Hence the number of farms which have the element"combe" in their name. The narrower Roncombe valley is similar to the Sid Valley.
